page.title: 05INTRODUCTION.
page.content: The river Witham flows south to north in the west of the area. Its valley floor only 50 metres above sea level it is flanked by older sand and gravel terraces and has a wide and well_marked alluvial flood plain. The highest part of the area is 120 metres close by the High Dyke road,(the old Roman Ermine street) near Londonthorpe in the N.E.corner. 75% of the area is RURAL in this N.E. zone whilst the S.W. 25% is URBAN. The National Trust which protects country and coastline, gardens and historic buildings for the nation plays an important role in this area. Belton House, a late 17th century stately home, and the estate park close by have in recent years become the responsibility of the Trust
